group_1.narration: I learned from Tsukasa that@our father works as a craftsman as@part of the Amane Bamboo Studio.
Thus, I came to know that I was@originally born under the name "Amane."
Once we got to know each other,@we spoke about ourselves as if everything@we had bottled up burst forth at once.

group_1.textLeft: I'm forced to undergo training every waking@hour, including weekends!
Of course, I understand it is the burden@women of Mizuna must bear.
I've learned a lot, and the deeper meaning@behind the training is not lost on me.
However, is it necessary to destroy my@sense of self to accomplish that feat?!
All I hear is Mizuna, Mizuna, Mizuna!@I have had enough!
As a result, I have no time for leisure.
Although many hold me in great respect...
...not a single person has offered me@friendship!
Do you understand this loneliness?@This isolation?!

group_1.textRight: We have so much in common.

group_1.narration: Perhaps it was due to our similar upbringing,@or perhaps because we are twins...@The reason eludes me.
However, Tsukasa was the first person@I've ever been able to tell how I truly@feel without restraint.

group_1.textLeft: I would love to talk with you again sometime.

group_1.textRight: We don't need to act like we're strangers.

group_1.narration: Thus, we exchanged contact information,@and began speaking on a regular basis.
Just as our parents had concealed us from @one another, we registered each other under@false names in our contacts.
Like our flutes, the two of us became one.
I entered her name in my phone@as a circle, to represent a full moon.
Unfortunately, this intimate time @would not last for very long.

group_1.textCenter: There was a deeper meaning behind@the flutes we received from our father.
